author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**musalbas**
my initial experiment with the public IPFS DHT, where node A puts a 32-byte file into the network, and node B gets the file via its hash (both nodes in the same city), shows an average latency of ~100ms to find + get the file. I guess more experimentation would be needed when the file is being put via multiple nodes, as maybe it's cheating via some optimisation when 2 nodes first talk to each other, though I've confirmed node A and B aren't maintaining a direct connection with each other. IPFS also supports private DHTs, so in theory you can construct a DHT where the only keys allowed are ones that correspond to blocks that have consensus, thus significantly reducing the size of the DHT.
Also, the IPFS daemon maintains about ~1000 TCP connections FWIW...
